title: OGA Round Britain Challenge  2013
name: OGA Round Britain Challenge  2013
description:
Routes of the OGA vessels participating in the Round Britain Challenge: April - August 2013.

Anchors represent home ports of vessels, with sailing boats marking ports, harbours and notable places on passage. OGA events are marked with a glass of bubbly. Where possible the boats are listed at each port of call with links to blogs and 'Sailing by' www.sailing-by.org.uk

Please send any comments or contributions to:
editor@sailing-by.org.uk

properties.name: Pin Mill, Suffolk
properties.description: Home port Bonify

properties.name: Walton on the Naze, Essex
properties.description: Home port Witch

properties.name: North Fambridge, Essex
properties.description: Home port for Mary Ritchie

properties.name: Schermer, Netherlands
properties.description: Home port for Cine Mara

properties.name: Medemblik, Netherlands
properties.description: Home port for Windflower

properties.name: Makkum, Netherlands
properties.description: Home port for Vlieter, Morgaine and Raven.Vlieter crosses the North Sea to Ramsgate, arriving 22 April. Morgaine and Raven sail south down the Dutch coast.

properties.name: Willemstad, Netherlands
properties.description: Four Dutch boats delayed in Willemstad: 23 April. A Landrover crashes aboard Morgaine as she waits at the quayside with Leonora, Cine Mara and Raven.

properties.name: Heybridge Basin, Essex
properties.description: 21 April: First three East Coast boats departBonify, Witch and Mary Ritchie

properties.name: IJmuiden, Netherlands
properties.description: First four Dutch boats depart 21 April: Raven, Morgaine, Cine Mara and Leonora III

properties.name: Faversham, Kent
properties.description: Home port for Bonita and Cygnet of London26 April Bonita departs, heading for Ramsgate. Cygnet departs 6 May to catch up with the fleet already in the Solent.

properties.name: Ramsgate, Kent
properties.description: 22 April finds the small fleet in Ramsgate: Vlieter (Netherlands), Bonify, Witch and Mary Ritchie (East Coast).23 April: Bonify departs Ramsgate to cross the Channel and visit the French coast27 April: Bonita and Windbreker in Ramsgate.

properties.name: Stellendam/Hellevoetsluis, Netherlands
properties.description: Home port for Windbreker.26 April: Windbreker departs for Ramsgate to be reunited with Koosje, ship's dog, who travelled the North Sea by ferry.

properties.name: Flushing, Netherlands
properties.description: 26 April: Windflower, Cine Mara, Morgaine, Raven and Leonora III depart Flushing heading for Nieuport, Belgium

properties.name: Boulogne-sur-Mer, France
properties.description: 23 April: Bonify arrives in Boulogne after a rough and foggy crossing from Ramsgate.

properties.name: Dover, Kent
properties.description: 23 April finds Witch and Mary Ritchie fog-bound in Dover.26 April: Witch, Mary Ritchie and Vlieter depart Dover.28 April: Windbreker anchors in Dover, waiting favourable winds.

properties.name: Rye, Sussex
properties.description: 29 April: Dutch fleet arrives on English coast.

properties.name: Eastbourne, East Sussex
properties.description: 26 April: Witch, Mary Ritchie and Vlieter arrive Eastbourne from Dover.27 April: Witch, Mary Ritchie and Vlieter depart Eastbourne, headed for Brighton.

properties.name: Dieppe, France
properties.description: 26 April: Bonify motor-sails 50 miles from Boulogne to arrive Dieppe.

properties.name: Brighton, Kent
properties.description: 27 April: Witch, Mary Ritchie and Vlieter arrive Brighton.30 April: Windbreker arrives in Brighton.

properties.name: Fecamp, France
properties.description: 28 April: Bonify enjoys the sunny weather on the French coast, waiting for favourable winds to cross back to the Solent.

properties.name: Honfleur, France
properties.description: 30 April: Bonify struggles to reach Honfleur against wind and tide. After another couple of days, she eventually leaves France to reach the Solent in time for the party.

properties.name: Portsmouth
properties.description: Home port for Rowspar28 April: Witch and Mary Ritchie arrive, joined by Vlieter 30 April1 May: Windbreker arrives Portsmouth, motor-sailing from Brighton3 May: South coast boats begin to gather including Toucando

properties.name: Southampton
properties.description: Home port for Harginger, Toucando, East Breeze, Passager

properties.name: The Hamble
properties.description: Hamble fleet gathers, joining boats from East Coast and Netherlands: 5 MayOGA fleet departs after the party: 5 MayHome port for Annabel J, Beagle of Woodbridge, Coriander, Helen of Hamble, Roma, Sepia, Sophie

properties.name: Yarmouth, Isle of Wight
properties.description: Home port for Furstin, Lone Wolf30 April: East Coast boats Witch and Mary Ritchie moor at Royal Solent YC

properties.name: Poole, Dorset
properties.description: Home port Susan J

properties.name: Weymouth, Dorset
properties.description: 1 May: Bonita and Witch take shelter in Weymouth as they take advantage of favourable winds to continue westwards.

properties.name: Portland Bill
properties.description: Bonita rounds Portland Bill

properties.name: Torquay, Devon
properties.description: 3 May: Bonita reaches Torquay.

properties.name: Dartmouth, Devon
properties.description: 4 May: Witch has excellent service from the shipwright in Darthaven Marina.

properties.name: Plymouth, Devon
properties.description: 10 May: stormbound in Plymouth.30 boats gather at the Mayflower Marina and several are forced to stay almost a week, several Solent boats return east.13 May: fleet departs Plymouth.

properties.name: Newlyn
properties.description: 13 May: Annabel J is the first boat to reach the west of Cornwall, taking refuge from the gale force storms.

properties.name: Fowey
properties.description: 14 May: Dutch boats Vlieter, Morgaine, Leonora III and Raven have good shelter from gales hitting the south west coast.

properties.name: Falmouth
properties.description: 14 May: Fleet is stormbound again, with gale force winds hitting the south west coast. Bonify, High Barbaree, Witch, Cine Mara, Windbreker and Syene are safely anchored to the Marina pontoons.16 May: Witch returns to Falmouth for repairs to hull, after setting out for the Helford River. Bonita arrives from Falmouth.

properties.name: Land's End
properties.description: 16 May: Annabel J, High Barbaree, Bonify and Syene round Lands End in lumpy seas heading for Milford Haven.Cine Mare and Bonita sail across to Ireland.

properties.name: Cork
properties.description: 16 May: Cine Mare the Dutch replica Galway hooker, sails from Falmouth to Cork.

properties.name: Waterford
properties.description: 19 May: Bonita sails from Falmouth to Waterford.

properties.name: Scilly Isles
properties.description: Only three boats make it to the Scilly Isles, due to the stormy weather and adverse winds, sadly missing the party. Dutch boats Leonora III, Morgaine and Raven enjoy their visit.

properties.name: Milford Haven
properties.description: 18 May: Bristol Channel OGA welcomes Bonify, Syene, High Barbaree, Annabel J, Toucando, Vlieter, Windbreker, Witch, Moon River, Cygnet of London as local boat Capraia joins the Round Britain fleet.

properties.name: Solva
properties.description: 24 May: Most of the fleet remain stormbound, again, in Milford Haven, forced to enjoy coastal walks instead of sailing. Annabel J makes passage for Skomer and Solva.

properties.name: Holyhead
properties.description: 27 May: Just in time for the planned party, and wonderful welcome from the North Wales OGA, Annabel J, High Barbaree, Bonify, Witch, Toucando, Windbreker, Windflower, Syene and Capraia eventually arrives in Holyhead, to be joined by new boats: Comrade, Master Frank, Petunia, Minstrel and Greensleeves

properties.name: Dun Laoghaire
properties.description: 29 May: High Barbaree, Windflower, Bonify and Greensleeves sailed in company Holyhead to Dun Laoghaire

properties.name: Howth
properties.description: 29 May: Cygnet of London, Toucando, Windbreker and Annabel J cross the Irish Sea from Holyhead to Howth.Howth 17s fleet joins the OGA party with racing and celebrations in Dublin.

properties.name: Dublin
properties.description: 21 May: Dutch boat Vlieter is the first boat to reach Dublin, in good time for the party.31 May - 3 June: OGA celebrations in Dublin.

properties.name: Peel, Isle of Man
properties.description: Master Frank joined the fleet from Peel.Some skippers and crews swapped helms for helmets and visited the Isle of Man during the TT.

properties.name: Belfast
properties.description: 10 May:Â  All together in Belfast for the party! Windbreker, Windflower, Cine Mara, Morgaine, Vlieter, Raven, Bonify, Cygnet of London, Greensleeves, Peggy, Witch, Toucando, Annabel J, High Barbaree, Leonora III, Syene and Moon River.

properties.name: Bangor
properties.description: 7 June finds Windbreker, Windflower, Bonify, Witch, High Barbaree, Toucando and Annabel J in Bangor, Ireland.

properties.name: Isle of Gigha
properties.description: 10 June: Witch returns to her roots and is featured in Classic Boat Magazine.

properties.name: Gairloch
properties.description: 10 June: OGA Scotland boats, Tantina II and Naiad join the fleet and sail to Gairloch.

properties.name: Tarbert
properties.description: Tarbert, a very common place-name in Scotland. Do you know why?

properties.name: Crinan Canal
properties.description: Several boats take the shortcut locking through the beautiful nine miles of Crinan Canal.

properties.name: Loch Melfort
properties.description: 15 June: East Coast members host the OGA Round Britain Challenge fleet for a party at Loch Melfort with over 100 skippers, crews and local people enjoying an excellent weekend of music, feasting and sailing.

properties.name: Stornoway
properties.description: 15 June: The boats intending to sail 'round the top' had a great weekend of racing and parties with Sail Stornoway: local boats Ammonite, Jubilee and El Vigo welcomed members of the fleet Minstrel, Bonita, Naiad, Windbreker and Tantina II.

properties.name: Plockton
properties.description: Bonify returns to Plockton, where she was purchased by Howard.

properties.name: Kirkwall, Orkney
properties.description: 21 June: Bonita enjoys midsummer's weekend on Orkney.

properties.name: Stromness, Orkney
properties.description: 21 June: Naiad and Tantina II take shelter in Stromness on passage to Shetland.

properties.name: Scalloway, Shetland
properties.description: 22 June: Windbreker from the Netherlands, Minstrel, Tantina II and Naiad reach Shetland to join local boat Larry for a warm welcome in Scalloway.

properties.name: Fort Augustus
properties.description: Most of the fleet take the Caledonian Canal route from the west coast to the North Sea.

properties.name: Inverness
properties.description: 26 June: fleet departs the Caledonian Canal

properties.name: Peterhead
properties.description: 22 June: Syene reaches Peterhead.

properties.name: Stonehaven
properties.description: 26 June: Vlieter, Syene and Capraia shelter in the harbour at Stonehaven.

properties.name: Arbroath
properties.description: 27 June: Vlieter and Syene reach Arbroath.

properties.name: Eyemouth
properties.description: 26 June: Bonita reaches Eyemouth

properties.name: Scarborough
properties.description: 25 June: Snoopy, 18' ship's jolly boat, sails single-handed from the Netherlands, arrives Scarborough sailing north (counter-clockwise circumnavigation).

properties.name: Brightlingsea
properties.description: 27 July: East Coast Race

properties.name: Cowes, Isle of Wight
properties.description: Greatest gathering of gaffers: 15 - 18 August 2013Home port for Polly Agatha, Nightingale
